channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.title: Report X-2024040337
item.description:
Report X-2024040337

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-28
  • City: MADISON
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered in QA area in a bin with a plastic liner. DescribePack: One of the 5L bottles had a corroded inner seal, which caused the bottle to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a bin with a plastic liner.

item.title: Report X-2024040318
item.description:
Report X-2024040318

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-28
  • City: MOSINEE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The unload team were unloading a trailer when the package was notice and QA was notified. cleaned and concealed for further inspections. DescribePack: The problem for this package was lack of packing skills with liquids. There was no cap on my container and the container was put inside of the box sideways. so almost all the liquid spilled thru the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: separate the package from others and put in a better container

item.title: Report X-2024040197
item.description:
Report X-2024040197

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-12T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-05
  • City: OAK CREEK
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO, CLEANED UP AND TRANSPORTED LEAKING PACKAGE TO DMP. UPON INSPECTION THE 5 GALLON STEEL BUCKET WAS DENTED AND CRUSHED ON THE BOTTOM RIM CORNER, LEAKED FROM A SMALL HOLE.

item.title: Report E-2024040239
item.description:
